reviewText: I no longer have any friends, my wife left me, my kids don't want to see me, and i lost my 7 figure salary career. But, it's all been worth it. Since i bought this game many moons ago, I have not left my house, and although the real-world aspects of my life have dissolved, i have barely noticed due to the inexpressible amazingness of this game. And best of all, it only took me 3.142 seconds to type this review.

reviewText:
A fun game to learn typing, Typer Shark! Deluxe is a fun game. Diving to shipwrecks in order to find valuable treasures (and fending off hungry sealife by electro shocks generated from vicious typing) becomes repetitive after a while, but it is definitely one of the more fun ways of learning how to touchtype.

The problem I have with Typer Shark is the fact that it can't be properly shut down. It will run on in the background and log more and more time, unless you reboot the computer. That is a bit annoying, and it would be really nice if that would be gotten rid of in a future update (though I suppose this won't really happen).

Since I don't feel like I can learn much more from this game, I will clock it as played through" and turn towards other games."

reviewText:
I actually like typing games, loved Mario teaches typing back on Win 3.1

I have Typing of the Dead and some other games involving typing, even have TOTD on my Dreamcast.

But I also have two young kids, and TOTD is not really a good fit right now :P

I snagged this on sale, and did not think much of it.  Mostly, I figured it was for kids, a learning experience or edutainment type game.

Honestly...  I don't mind typing a few sharks to death myself!

Wouldn't mind some awards or new typing adventures (beyond this diver theme, even a new game entirely, I'd pay for variety)

Really, if you see it on sale again, or have the full price, it is more than it appears.  If you like to practice typing, want a game that will run on near anything, and don't mind killing sharks, you should buy this game.

reviewText: Bought 'Typer Shark Deluxe' to improve my typing speed and although it isn't challenging enough for me it is perfect for anyone new to touch typing. The only complaint I have about 'Typer Shark Deluxe' is that it doesn't shut down properly and doesn't show in task manager so I have to restart my computer to close the game.\n\nIf you want to become an expert at touch typing I would recommend starting with 'Typer Shark Deluxe' and moving on to 'Typing Of The Dead' when 'Typer Shark Deluxe' starts to seem to easy.

reviewText: If you want to improve your typing skills while playing a game then this is the game for you. It really does stretch your typing skills by giving you multiple challenges to work with. It will test you and push you to type faster and more accurate then you thought possible. It can be frustrating at times to get all the words on the screen but with practice you can type really fast with this game. It has a story mode were you try to get diamonds. You will get attacked by Sharks and other fish of the ocean which makes it fun to attack all the fish, you will be challenged with single letters and whole words. This is a great learning game and great for anyone wanting to grow with their typing skills.

reviewText: While the design of this game/application is done pretty well, but the execution of it is lacking. I have windows 10 on my desktop where this game is installed. Not only does this game not propperly terminate when instructed to exit, but it also triggers all sorts of warnings from my AVG protection. When exiting the game, it will minimize, but the popcapgame1 process is still active. You will be unable to restart the game until you manually kill the process in Task Manager. Even though this game is only $5 it is not worth the hassle, and I would strongly suggest not even giving it a spin.
